title: I thought Taric was the first LGBTQ champ
body: Unless I've been interpreting his lines and some of those outfits wrong....

replies.body: {{champion:110}}  Am I a joke to you?

Varus isn't gay though.
He just absorbed the souls and flesh of gay people.

You are one of people that can analyze and understand the lore objectively (or at least try it).

So many people still believing Varus is gay. Some of them arent aware Varus is a darkin.
Taric before Targon would feel for someone despite the gender IMO. Taric after Targon wound't fall in love because of his mission and knowledge that he got.

Taric has not been confirmed as gay. He's the problem that is the "illusion of inclusion," much like Varus. They've hedged, and made innuendo, and hinted, but that's all just smoke and mirrors because he has never been directly confirmed. In Varus' case, Varus, the Darkin, isn't gay, but the two men who's body he stole is. But you don't play the two men, you play Varus. This is the entire issue with Riot's approach to LGBT characters - they have never actually given us a legitimate character, just hazy guess work and reach arounds.

Neeko is the first absolutely confirmed LGBT character in the game. That's why she's making such a big splash. And if her line to Taric is any indication, this could mean they're finally confirming him as gay as well.
